column2: IDAHO DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
Question Text
1. If you begin to feel drowsy while driving, you should:
2. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
3. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.

column2: 4. When changing lanes, you can check your blind spot by:
column4: turning your head and glancing over your shoulder.
column10: checking the rearview and outside mirrors.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
6. When driving through school zones:
column6: always drive at 20 MPH or less.
column10: remember that students must always yield right-of-way to vehicles.

column2: 7. This sign means:
column6: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column8: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column10: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column4: You are about to enter a one-way street the wrong way
column8: You may proceed only if the way is clear

column2: 9. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
10. When changing lanes, __________ to be sure no one is in the "blind spot".
11. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column6: It helps increase your stopping distance.

column2: 12. Motor vehicles must yield to pedestrians:
column4: when the pedestrian is in a crosswalk at an intersection.
column8: only when the pedestrian is blind.

column2: 13. Studies show that wearing seat belts:
column4: increases your chances of fatality in a crash.
column6: reduces your chances of serious injury in a crash.
column8: reduces your chances of damaging your car in a crash.

column2: 14. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column6: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column8: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.

column2: 15. This sign tells drivers that:
column6: they must stop at the next intersection.
column10: left and right turns are not allowed.

column2: 16. When you park parallel to a curb, you must:
column4: park within 24 inches of the curb or edge of roadway.
column6: park within 18 inches of the curb.
column8: park facing the opposite direction of the flow of traffic on your side of the road.
column10: park at an angle with the rear of your vehicle sticking out into traffic.

column2: 17. Night driving can be more difficult because:
column4: the ratio of motorcyles to cars is much higher at night.
column8: vehicle operators tend to drive faster at night.
column10: speed limits do not apply at night.

column2: 18. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column6: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column8: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column10: To keep a smooth traffic flow.

column2: 19. When you come to an intersection with a flashing red light, you must:
column4: stop at the intersection and wait for a flashing green light.
column6: stop only if cars are approaching the intersection.
column8: stop at the intersection, then proceed when safe and observe the right-of-way rules.
column10: slow down and drive carefully through the  intersection.

column2: 20. When driving on a freeway, drivers must know that:
column4: vehicles may travel up to 95 MPH.
column6: a minimum speed limit may be posted.
column8: they should change their speed frequently to adapt to keep up with the flow of traffic.

column2: 21. A driver approaching a flashing red traffic signal must:
column4: slow down at the traffic signal.
column8: carefully drive through the intersection without stopping.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column10: Traffic is entering from another road, drive with caution

column2: 23. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column8: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column2: 24. Braking distance is affected by:
column6: the speed your vehicle is traveling.
column8: the condition of your brakes and tires.

column2: 25. A steady yellow light at an intersection means:
column4: Proceed with caution through the intersection
column6: Slow down and be prepared to stop
column10: Immediately come to a complete stop

column2: 26. The most common cause of traffic crashes is:
27. This road sign means:
column6: Right turn on red light permitted
column10: All traffic must turn right at next intersection

column2: 28. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
29. This road sign means:
30. The best way to deal with tailgaters is to:
column6: pump your brakes to get them to back off.
column8: speed up to increase the space between you and the tailgater.
column10: slow down to encourage the tailgater to pass.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
32. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column4: pull over to the side of the road and stop.
column8: slow down until it passes you.
column10: increase your speed to provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle.

column2: 33. Select the best answer. Before backing a car out of a driveway, you should:
column4: check your rearview mirrors to see what is behind you.
column6: check behind the vehicle before you get in.
column10: honk the horn right before backing up.

column2: 34. This road sign means:
column4: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.
column6: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column8: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column10: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.

column2: 35. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
36. A flashing red traffic light:
column4: is used to indicate a pedestrian crossing.
column6: has the same meaning as a yield sign.
column8: has the same meaning as a stop sign.
column10: indicates that you should drive with caution.

column2: 37. When approaching someone using a white cane, you should proceed with caution because:
column6: the pedestrian might be using a guide dog.

column2: 38. This sign means:
39. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column6: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column10: Wait for the next green light.

column2: 40. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column6: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: stop doing what they are doing.
column10: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
